com.example.android.bluetoothlegatt

Class DeviceControlActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.Context
      • android.content.ContextWrapper
        • android.view.ContextThemeWrapper
          • android.app.Activity
            • com.example.android.bluetoothlegatt.DeviceControlActivity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory2, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, android.view.Window.Callback

    public class DeviceControlActivity
extends android.app.Activity
    For a given BLE device, this Activity provides the user interface to connect, display data, and display GATT services and characteristics supported by the device. The Activity communicates with BluetoothLeService, which in turn interacts with the Bluetooth LE API.

      • mGattUpdateReceiver

        private final android.content.BroadcastReceiver mGattUpdateReceiver
        Handles various events fired by the Service. ACTION_GATT_CONNECTED: connected to a GATT server. ACTION_GATT_DISCONNECTED: disconnected from a GATT server. ACTION_GATT_SERVICES_DISCOVERED: discovered GATT services. ACTION_DATA_AVAILABLE: received data from the device. This can be a result of read or notification operations.
